text: King Wu of Zhou (), personal name Ji Fa, was the founding king of the Chinese Zhou dynasty. He became king around 1046 BCE. He died three years later.These dates are those of the People's Republic of China's official Xia–Shang–Zhou Chronology Project, although they remain controversial. ==Battle of Muye== The Battle of Muye (or Mu, or Muh; ) took place in ancient China between the rebel Zhou state and the Shang dynasty (that were in power). The Zhou army, led by Wu of Zhou, beat (or defeated) the defending army of king Di Xin of Shang at Muye and captured the Shang capital Yin. That ended the Shang dynasty. ==Notes== ==Sources== Category:China
title: King Wu of Zhou
